did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The collection is comprised of comic books, from 1934-1969 (bulk 1940-1950) which are held in Special Collections.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Special Collecion's Comic Book Collection (MS 474). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into one series

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: A comic book is a magazine made of pictorial elements that tell a story. The narrative proceeds through the use of individual panels that represent different scene. Communication between characters is usually represented with “speech” or “word” balloons; as well as descriptive prose presented in text boxes. The comic books in this collection are indicative of many of the comics from this era. Printed on newsprint, and not properly cared for before introduction into this facility, many comics from this era are in quite poor condition. This collection is comprised of adventure, humorous, horror, cowboy, romance, war, science-fiction, and super-hero comics.

This series is arranged alphabetical, by title. Titles are taken from the cover and not from the copyright information from inside the comic. The title supplied does not include serial (series) title changes either.
